physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe headache, hypertension, tachycardia, clinical suspicion of pheochromocytoma.
Thyroid ultrasound showed a 5 mm thyroid nodule; basal calcitonin elevated at 7.9 pg/mL, stimulated to 492 pg/mL after pentagastrin.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Baseline calcitonin normal in all visits before, now mildly elevated suggesting the development of medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC).
